page.title: 06CONSERVATION, RANBY AREA
page.content: In an area such as this, where soils are light and arid, and where wind erosion is a problem, conservation is particularly important. In addition, the pressure to make farming profitable, leads to a tendency to create larger fields by removing hedgerows, to plough wherever possible, and to use large quantities of chemical sprays. One farmer's opinion is that to farm successfully here, top priority had to be given to schemes of irrigation and wind-break. This farmer also has an interest in wild life, and to protect it has left the heads of several fields unsprayed. This will reduce the yield by as much as one third but he considers the sacrifice worthwhile. He recently observed some baby partridges which had hatched on one of the unsprayed areas.
